document.heading: District of Columbia Public Emergency Act of 1980

history.narrative: Law 3-149, the “District of Columbia Public Emergency Act of 1980,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-198, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 30, 1980 and October 14, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 29, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-274 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
